content.raw:
ya I thought about that but that means now gazebo msg will  need to depend on gazebo rendering. I could have a generic `msgs::ConvertVisualType`  that converts `msgs::Visual::Type` to a string but I would then need to do another conversion to get the string back to a `VisualType`. 

Alternatively, I can have a static member function in somewhere in rendering to do the conversion `msg::Visual::Type` <-> `VisualType`. How does that sound?
content.html:
ya I thought about that but that means now gazebo msg will need to depend on gazebo rendering. I could have a generic msgs::ConvertVisualType that converts msgs::Visual::Type to a string but I would then need to do another conversion to get the string back to a VisualType.

Alternatively, I can have a static member function in somewhere in rendering to do the conversion msg::Visual::Type <-> VisualType. How does that sound?
